definition: A human-readable, plain text format for expressing structured data with support in many programming languages.
A data processing and aggregation paradigm consisting of a “map” phase that selects data and a “reduce” phase that transforms the data.
The routing and load balancing process that acts an interface between an application and a MongoDB sharded cluster.
The MongoDB database server. The MongoDB server manages data requests and formats and manages background operations.
A very inefficient query execution strategy which requires MongoDB to inspect every document in a collection to see if it matches the query criteria.
The conventional name for a background, non-interactive process.
A record in a MongoDB collection and the basic unit of data in MongoDB.
A serialization format used to store documents and make remote procedure calls in MongoDB.  Named by combining the words “binary” and “JSON”.
An acronym for the fundamental operations of a database: Create, Read, Update, and Delete.
A data structure that optimizes queries.
Relational Database Management System. A database management system based on the relational model, typically using SQL as the query language.
January 1st, 1970 at 00:00:00 UTC. Commonly used in expressing time, where the number of seconds or milliseconds since this point is counted.
